docs.text: it's an interesting premise .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: our reality is only real to us because it is what we perceive to be real .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in truth , our entire existences are lived out in our minds as we are fed information through electronic inputs directly to our brains .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what we see , what we do , everything around us is nothing more than a computer-generated construct interlinked with the minds of others through a vastly powerful artificial intelligence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: our bodies , severely atrophied , are kept alive for the sole purpose of generating heat and electrical energy for a dominating order of machines which control the planet .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the sci-fi realm has been waiting a little while for something new to come along .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the matrix isn't it - the idea of a war between man and a sentient computer network , a sham world , the ability to plug one's brain into a computer , has all been gleaned from such sources as the terminator , dark city , and a few star trek episodes ( both classic and next generation ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what is new is the ability to weave all of these various elements together and succeed in producing a film that is both entertaining as well as thought-provoking .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: keanu reeves plays a computer whiz nicknamed neo , who is plucked out of the artificial world ( known as the matrix ) by a group of renegade humans who are clandestinely fighting to expose the fallacy of the computer-generated existence and free humankind from the oppression of the machines .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the group's leader , morpheus ( laurence fishburne ) , has chosen neo because he believes neo is " the one " who is destined to lead the attack against the artificial intelligence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: >from the beginning of the film , we are kept on our toes trying to figure things out .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this , in a lesser movie would be annoying , but the matrix presents itself in an intelligent manner which makes the puzzle rather interesting and even fun .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what is reality ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what is a sham ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film turns our very perception of life on its side .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: more than once , we are also presented with the question of whether we would rather know the harsh truth of reality , or live a life of relative bliss , oblivious to the true nature of our surroundings .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as viewers , this is intriguing enough , so imagine what it would be like for neo .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and who to better play a bewildered person than keanu reeves ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: reeves , whom i've never really cared for as an actor , is competent in roles which require a lot of straightforwardness , and little subtlety .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he was good in speed , for example , but laughably poor in a walk in the clouds .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: neo is actually one of those roles which reeves slips into rather nicely , so much of my expectation was happily for naught .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in a couple of places , the script even capitalizes upon his wooden nature , and this is a heavy credit to writers/directors andy and larry wachowski .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i mean , since bill and ted's excellent adventure , what movie could you say really " utilized " keanu reeves ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: more interesting than reeves is fishburne , who's morpheus nearly runs the gamut of emotions , and convincingly so .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: very surprising for a sci-fi movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: fishburne also maintains a certain demeanor about himself throughout , as if he always knows what to expect .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this helps to further the aura of his character's proficiency and extensive knowledge .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hugo weaving as agent smith , one of the artificial intelligence's anti-intruder programs , is also good playing his deadpan , no-nonsense , kick ass role , which requires him to show emotion at the appropriate time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unfortunately , when weaving speaks for more than a few sentences in a row , the nature of his character's speech pattern becomes a little more laughable than impressive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: carrie-anne moss plays trinity , morpheus's number one assistant who becomes somewhat of a love interest for neo .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: although her character is somewhat inconsistent , moss nevertheless delivers an above par performance when fishburne isn't in the picture .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there were few expenses spared when it comes to the special effects .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: many methods of imagery are employed , from modeling to bluescreen to computer graphics .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: of special note is the use of the " freeze and turn " effect where the entire scene is frozen , turned , then continued from a new angle .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is accomplished by using a large number of still cameras employed in a semi-circle , with motion picture cameras placed at the two ends .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the motion cameras film the action , and at the appropriate moment all the still cameras fire at once .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: place each still image in a film sequence and you get a nearly seamless transition from the first motion camera to the second .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: pretty slick .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the matrix drips with style .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: from the clothing to the music to the action , we're watching an exaggerated version of what we're used to .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: much of it seems like the combination of two genres of the hong kong action film - there's a lot of kung fu , there's a lot of gunplay .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when a character is letting go with an automatic weapon , much is made of the empty cartridges falling to the floor in slow motion .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there's also the element of the japanese action cartoon ( called anime by aficionados ) , especially in the way the sequences are filmed in sweeping pans and emphasized actions through special effects .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: combined , it's really like no live-action film i have ever seen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film is not without its faults .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: some of the scenes and ideas are " borrowed " a little too liberally from other films , and one component of the ending is decidedly disappointing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: some of the lines are also pretty bad - in one instance , a supporting character incorrectly delivers a famous saying , and it wasn't meant to be a joke .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , these shortcomings detract little from what is an overall solid action sci-fi film that for once does more than merely entertain .
docs.label: positive
